WorkItem.Description:
When changing between one character(file) with one model, to another character(file) with another model; Rawr very frequently crashes. I'm not sure if I should change the model first or the character(file) first... preferably I'd like the model to be part of the character(file).
I'm usually working with Bear, Cat and Tree model. And I'm doing so with one character with 3 different sets of gear. The character is feral specced, which may cause some issue for the tree model. I'm not sure, but I think the error has occured when swapping between bear/cat as well.
Â 
************** Exception Text **************
System.FormatException: Input string was not in a correct format.
at System.Number.StringToNumber(String str, NumberStyles options, NumberBuffer& number, NumberFormatInfo info, Boolean parseDecimal)
at System.Number.ParseInt32(String s, NumberStyles style, NumberFormatInfo info)
at System.Xml.XmlConvert.ToInt32(String s)

at Microsoft.Xml.Serialization.GeneratedAssembly.XmlSerializationReaderCalculationOptionsTree.Read5_CalculationOptionsTree()

Comments.Message:
I believe I havea the same issue.  I also work with cat, bear and tree files and I just opened my tree file from a couple versions back and it opened find but when I switched to the tree profile it crashed.  It's only when I open my resto while on tree.  It opens while on bear or cat.  Here is the error:

************** JIT Debugging **************
To enable just-in-time (JIT) debugging, the .config file for this
application or computer (machine.config) must have the
jitDebugging value set in the system.windows.forms section.
The application must also be compiled with debugging
enabled.

For example:

<configuration>
    <system.windows.forms jitDebugging="true" />
</configuration>

When JIT debugging is enabled, any unhandled exception
will be sent to the JIT debugger registered on the computer
rather than be handled by this dialog box.
